title: Wonderful B&B!
text: Our stay at the Rio Grande B&B far exceeded my expectations. Our room was upstairs and was very comfortable and clean. The bathroom was beautiful and even had heated floors. We had a spacious sitting room which was great to relax at the end of the evening. The hosts provided many comforts to make our stay enjoyable including freshly baked cookies, a container of bleach wipes (during Covid this was especially important!), a tote bag of beach towels for the Glenwood Hot Springs, and more. The breakfast was absolutely incredible! The quality and quantity was exceptional. The orange creme brûlée was my favorite! It is also conveniently located, and it is easy to walk into town or to the hot springs. We will definitely stay here the next time we visit Glenwood! I highly recommend staying here!

title: Hidden Gem, Peaceful Place!
text: Our stay at the Double G Guestranch was outstanding! Our hosts, Frank and Sandra, were gracious, accommodating, friendly, and helpful. From the minute we arrived we were treated wonderfully. Our room, the "Eagle's Nest" was spacious, clean, and comfortable. The 360 views were stunning. We ate dinner at the resort, and Sandra prepared a delicious homemade meal. Breakfast was also wonderful. Although a small and remote property, it is beautiful--horses, views, privacy! We enjoyed everything about our stay, and we hope to go back again!

title: Excellent service, great pizza!
text: We were in Vincennes for Thanksgiving week and ate at Renine Thanksgiving night. We were all tired after a day at Versailles, but were able to make a reservation here based on great reviews. When we got there, the server did not speak much English, and my French is barely passable. However, she was amazingly patient with me, and together, we were able to order for all of us (we were a party of six plus two babies). Her attitude, service, and help was incredible (I wish I knew/remembered her name to give her the credit!. The pizzas were delicious (although not our typical Thanksgiving meal in France!), and we had a wonderful experience. I can't wait to go back here when in Vincennes again. Excellent!

title: Lots of potential, charming Bayeux
text: Hotel Chateau De Bellefontaine has incredible potential. We took our family there and booked three rooms (our daughters and their families have babies). We had three separate rooms, and we were surprised how differently appointed they all were! My husband's and my room was quite spacious, and the bathroom was huge. It did not have a shower, just a shower handle in a tub. The grounds are beautiful, and they provide an extensive breakfast (although not inexpensive). It is in a great location, and in summer would be amazing. We were there at a chilly time of year. The hotel is a little tired and could use some maintenance, but we did enjoy our stay here. I would go back for sure, but I would prefer the summer so I could spend time on their magnificent grounds.

title: Amazing Parisian Suburb--surpassed expectations!
text: We stayed here for Thanksgiving week with our whole family--daughters, sons-in-laws, and grandbabies. We were so pleasantly surprised with how much space the condo had! We had a three-bedroom, and we had more than enough room for six adults and two babies (with two cribs and high chairs, and a baby bath--provided by the resort). The kitchen was adequately accommodated and fit all of us. The living/family room was quite spacious, too. Vincennes was a quaint little town with all you could need. The metro ride into Paris was easy as well. The front desk staff varied (some knew every way to help us, and others did not have much knowledge). I ordered breakfast items to be in the room prior to our visit, and that was not done correctly, but the staff quickly handled it, and by the morning, we had what we ordered. Fresh croissants, coffee, baguettes, and more. The only real negative was the wifi was not good at all. We tried to talk to the front desk about this, but they were completely unable to fix it for us. I will definitely stay here again (especially with a larger group). We loved our stay!

title: Our favorite restaurant at Denver International Airport
text: We eat here before almost every trip out of DIA, and we are never disappointed. Although a bit pricey, we enjoy every meal here. We find it to provide good service, great food, and a relaxing atmosphere. We like the set up (great baggage storage!), the menu (I can get a good gluten free meal), the drinks, and the overall feel. This is always a stop for us, especially before an international trip. We find it to be consistent and reliable. I'd recommend it for sure when traveling through Denver.

title: Not a bad choice at DIA
text: We typically eat somewhere else when at DIA, but we were traveling with our daughter, son-in-law, and 2 month old grandson, so we picked the easiest, and what we thought would be the fasted, location. While the food was good, the service was extremely slow. Our server was pleasant enough, but it seemed challenging to get orders in on time. We ordered to-go meals as well as we were traveling internationally, so maybe that was part of the slow down. I would maybe go back, but we have other favorites while traveling through DIA.

title: Delicious BBQ
text: Shorty's is part of my past--I grew up going here for as long as I can remember (even to the original location that burned down). The bbq pork platter is delicious--go hungry for sure! We love the Shorty's sauce even more than the bbq sauce--smoky and yummy. The corn on the cob is a must (although it has a ton of butter--yum!). We go every time we go to South Florida for great bbq!

title: Seafood!
text: We've been going to the Rustic Inn for many, many years. Their seafood is delicious, and they offer many choices. (This trip wasn't quite as good as I remembered, but it was still great.) We took all our parents for dinner, and they all loved their meals. The portions are huge! The service was very good. Great south Florida restaurant on the water. Go hungry!!

title: Chicken Wings!
text: We have been coming to Rickey's for more years than I care to admit. We grew up in South Florida, and frequented this restaurant on a regular basis. We moved from FL almost 30 years ago, and we make it a point to go here at least once on every visit. We were just there this weekend, and as usual, we had the chicken wings and were very happy. It's a small little bar, and not fancy at all! That adds to its charm! I will always visit this neighborhood bar for a great meal! (Their spicy bloody mary's are also awesome!)

title: Great start to NYC weekend
text: We heard a lot about Tavern on the Green--historic location, good food, beautiful place, as well as a "touristy location." Well, even if it is considered touristy, we thoroughly enjoyed our lunch here. The service was fantastic, and the food was excellent. We sat outside on a gorgeous June day and had a phenomenal lunch. It was a great way to start our trip!

title: Historical beauty!
text: Our visit to the Acropolis left me speechless. Yes, it was stifling hot (June)--bring water, hats, sunscreen and go early for sure! However, to stand on this incredibly old, historic sight was an experience we will never forget. Gorgeous! Do not go to Athens and miss this! Going early or late is a must or the crowds can overwhelm you.

title: Akrotiri Lighthouse
text: We truly loved driving down the coast and seeing the lighthouse at the end. It is a quick and simple trip, but offers stunning views. It was very hot in June, so go early if you can. Hike out and around the rocks for some amazing photos!

title: Quaint setting, delicious food
text: This restaurant has a fabulous location. It's directly on the water in a seaside cave. The food was absolutely delicious (fresh seafood was the best!). The cave itself was awesome, and walking around the area seeing the shops in the caves was a lot of fun. The service was adequate, the food spectacular. Not to miss!

title: Beautiful Castle
text: Beautifully preserved castle in Nafplio. Depending on what time of year you go, be sure to bring plenty of water (or go early in the day) as it gets quite hot. We drove to the top and then explored the castle ruins. Very well preserved and we loved the history. There are several bastions to explore and there are amazing views from the top. Don't miss this if you travel to Nafplio!

title: Yummy gelato in Nafplio
text: We were in Nafplio when it was incredibly hot. This gelato was delicious! We both loved it, and we loved the choices offered. The shop was super cute, and they have more than just gelato. We loved eating this great gelato in the air-conditioned shop. I would recommend enjoying a special treat here!

title: Fun with Friends in the French Quarter
text: Great historic place to experience New Orleans. We love the architecture, food, music, and people. We just wandered around and learned about the history--amazing. (Not exactly a place for kids though.) Great shops and restaurants to explore.

title: Fabulous lunch
text: We enjoyed a spectacular lunch experience at Commander's Palace with friends. They live in New Orleans, and they go here a lot and wanted us to experience it. What a great choice! We enjoyed the specialty drinks (great prices!), delicious food, and a fabulous atmosphere. The service was incredible as well. Delicious food New Orleans style. We will definitely go back!

title: Greek sized wine tasting and great views
text: We loved our visit to Santo Winery. We had a great table overlooking the crater, and we enjoyed our wine tasting experience. We had an excellent wine flight with several good wines. We also ordered a gourmet cheese platter which was incredible.

title: Good, but a bit expensive
text: We enjoyed dinner at Sierra even though it was a little pricey. Portions were not huge, and the food we ordered was quite tasty. My husband got the Louisiana Shrimp, and I had the steak tacos. Both were very good. The restaurant itself is in a nice location, and the building is quite nice. They even have wines from Pride Vineyard which surprised us--we love that vineyard. They do not have a separate gluten free menu which was a challenge for me, but I was able to choose between a few different items. Worth checking out!

title: Good location
text: We went up to Breck to leaf-peep last weekend. We read the reviews of BoLD and figured we'd give it a try. While the service was good and the food was tasty, we had several mistakes in our meal. I had to send my glass of wine back as it was filled with cork (I do know this happens, but it was part of the experience we faced that night). I ordered the Greek fries (they are supposed to come with truffle oil and feta) and got regular fries and they had to redo them. Then I ordered the ahi tacos and was give lamb and beef tacos instead which I also had to send back. My husband loved the pork chop, and the lobster bisque was quite tasty. All in all, the food and service was good, it was just frustrating to have to send back/reorder so many things. We will go back though and give it another try when we are in the area.

title: Great meal, beautiful view!
text: We stayed at the Kastalia Boutique Hotel, so we had the included breakfast in the morning which was provided by the Elia Restaurant. The breakfast wasn't anything fancy, but it was tasty (although they charged me extra to get a cup of decaf coffee which I found strange). We had lunch at Elia as well, and it was delicious. I'm not a big fish eater, but I tried the bream fish. It was fantastic--so good. My husband had the fish and chips and he also enjoyed that meal. Prices were quite reasonable, and the service was very good.

title: Informative small museum
text: The Delphi Archaeological Museum is small, but it has a lot of good and interesting artifacts. There are interactive computers that show what the temple might have looked like in it's time which I felt really helped me to better understand the site. Ideally, I would visit the museum after the site to cool off in the a/c, but visiting it beforehand helped us to better enjoy and understand what we were seeing at the site.

title: Delicious souvlaki!
text: We had dinner at Taverna Dion after viewing the ancient site at Delphi. We had planned on only stopping for a drink, but the menu was too tempting! Prices were very reasonable, and portions were large. We were served bread with two types of spreads which was delicious. We shared a souvlaki platter, and it was plenty for the two of us. Service was good, and they have a cute outside dining area. We enjoyed the Greek wines as well. Great restaurant!

title: Well preserved, beautiful ruins!
text: Delphi is a great site, but go early or go late to beat the heat and the crowds. We went about 15:00, and it was perfect (although still very hot!). There is a good little museum that gives helpful info before you view the site (or go after to cool off in the a/c). Wear comfy shoes as it is uphill. The craftsmanship these early people used was incredible! There are gorgeous views from the top. Great historical site!

title: Romantic Restaurant, Beautiful Location!
text: My husband and I ate here for our 30th anniversary trip. It is a charming little restaurant in an ideal and beautiful location. The staff was very nice and attentive. We were given the perfect table--it overlooked the ocean right next to the little church. The restaurant is located in a historic building filled with character. We started with an order of moussaka which was very tasty. We both ordered fish dishes which were absolutely delicious. It was a wonderful place to watch the sunset--very romantic. I would highly recommend eating here as a special night while on Mykonos!

title: Beautiful Old Port
text: The Old Port is a must see during your stay on Mykonos. It's a quaint, picturesque place where you can just take in the sights and sounds and do some fun people watching. It's a busy spot and is very close to the old streets of Mykonos where you can shop, browse, eat, or drink. There are lots of restaurants here, but we didn't eat at any as they seemed very touristy. Beautiful place to visit!

title: Historical Photo Spot
text: The windmills on Mykonos are a popular spot for tourists. They are beautiful, and they make for some stunning photographs. This is a good spot to see several of the famous windmills at one time (there are others in various spots on the island). A must see while visiting this beautiful island!

title: Convenient Location for Traveling through Newark Airport
text: We stayed here on a one-day stop over to Greece. We got in late and the shuttle picked us up at the airport. The room worked fine for us. It was big enough, clean, and the staff was nice and helpful. We spent the next day in NYC, and the hotel kept our bags for us. When we got back, we were able to use the Fitness Center showers to clean up before our overnight flight. We were able to take the shuttle back to the airport which was nice. I would stay here again while flying through Newark.

title: Close to Newark airport
text: We stayed here on our way home from a trip to Greece. They do have an airport shuttle, but be sure to tell them ahead of time if you need a ride back to the airport. We were unable to get on the shuttle we wanted as it was too crowded. The room is spacious, but it isn't anything special. My husband is a faithful Hilton Honors member, and we stay at many Hilton properties. This was my least favorite Hilton property we have ever stayed at. It worked for a quick stop-over, but I wouldn't stay here again.
place: Home2 Suites by Hilton Newark Airport

title: Excellent local dishes!
text: We were on Mykonos for four days, and we ate at Local twice--it was excellent! Their marinated pork was fabulous. We also had the pork gyros which were also quite good. Portions were large and prices were very reasonable. The staff was very friendly, even when they were very busy. Definitely eat here during your stay in Mykonos!

title: Excellent location!
text: Kastalia Boutique Hotel is in an excellent location in the tiny town/village of Delphi. It is an easy walk to the archaeological site of Delphi, only about 5-10 minutes away. The staff was very courteous and helpful and provided us with a lot of information about the ruins of Delphi and the town itself. Our room was plenty spacious enough, but nothing fancy. We had a beautiful view of the olive groves all the way to the Bay of Corinth. There is a good restaurant on site called Elia. We had lunch there, and it was quite delicious. The included breakfast was fine, but they did charge me extra to get a cup of decaf coffee which I found strange. We didn’t do anything in the town other than the ruins, but I would recommend a stay at Kastalia if you visit Delphi.

title: Gorgeous Boutique Hotel
text: We stayed at Gambello Luxury Rooms for two nights during our 30th anniversary trip to Greece. The hotel was in a great location, very close to the main town square with a view of the sea and the Bourtzi. The room was extremely clean, modern, and quite spacious. It was a nice, quiet hotel. The breakfast was €6 and was quite nice. They made eggs to order, a decaf Nespresso, plus the other cold options. There is only limited street parking, or you have to park at the port. It wasn't a problem for us, but if you have a lot of luggage, it could be a challenge. The staff was kind and welcoming, but we did not have many interactions with them. There is no one at the front desk in the evenings. I would highly recommend this hotel--excellent find!

title: Stunning views, charming hotel!
text: We stayed at Apanemo for our 30th anniversary trip to Greece. Located in Akrotiri instead of busy Fira or Oia was perfect for us. It is in a nice, quiet area yet it was easy to get around (I recommend having a car even though the staff was wonderful about driving you to close by places for free). Our room was a bit different as the bed is upstairs in the loft and was only accessible by ladder. We overlooked the sea and the caldera, and we loved the gorgeous views! The pool is a highlight (even though the water was chilly). It overlooks the caldera and is very nice. The included breakfast was good and offered both hot and cold options. They will even make you custom coffees. The bathroom sink was clogged at first, but the staff did fix that right away. The staff is very kind and friendly. I would recommend a stay at Apanemo when visiting Santorini!

title: Impeccable Service!
text: My husband and I spent four nights at Aeolos during our 30th anniversary trip to Greece. I cannot say enough good things about this wonderful hotel! Panos, the owner, and his staff are some of the friendliest, most helpful, and courteous people we have ever met. When we arrived, Panos provided us with a detailed overview of the island and the hotel. We were taken to two rooms and asked to select the room we wanted which was a nice touch. The room was modern and good-sized, and we overlooked the pool with a nice little patio. We ate lunch at the hotel the first day, and it was quite good. We enjoyed the outdoor patio in the evenings to relax and have a glass of wine. Breakfast was an excellent buffet with many good options. Panos even made me a wonderful cup of decaf coffee and brought it to me as soon as we came in for breakfast each morning. We walked or rode a rented scooter into town most of the time, but the staff willingly dropped us off in town as well, which was great. The walk into the old town is quite nice, the uphill climb on the way back isn’t as fun. I would recommend taking a taxi back, especially if it is late. I highly recommend Aeolos Hotel for a stay on Mykonos. It was an excellent stay, superb service, and a wonderful experience!

title: Caring Crew!
text: The crew on my flight was incredible! I was in the middle of driving from Florida to Colorado with one daughter when my other daughter in Colorado found out she was going to deliver her baby early! I needed to get home! We were close to Atlanta, so I managed to book a last minute flight home. The staff member at the counter was very helpful with my booking, and she helped to try to get me out of Atlanta ASAP. When I got to the gate, the pilot/captain was there. I jokingly asked him to get to Denver as fast as he could. He came back to me a little while later, told me he had made arrangements for me to join the preboarding group so I could sit up front and get off the plane as quickly as I could. He did everything he could to help me out. Obviously, he could only fly the way he was supposed to--safely!, but he went out of his way to calm me down and help me out. The flight attendants were also very kind and gracious. The entire Southwest staff was very amazing, caring, and helpful. We fly Southwest a lot, but this trip confirms to me why we keep using them! (And, yes! I made it (just barely!) before my first grandchild made her appearance!)

title: Unique! Don't miss!
text: This was a very interesting, and unique, experience. We had no idea what to expect, and we were definitely not disappointed! It is a huge limestone cave with projected art work (huge!) and a variety of matching themed music. We saw Picasso and Spanish art masters' works projected on the massive limestone quarry walls. Images swirl, wash down the walls, and seemingly dance to the music. A must if you are in the area. Bring a sweater as it is a bit chilly inside.

title: Charming fairy tale village! Must see!
text: This beautiful village high on the hilltop of stone was one of my favorite stops in Provence. We visited after going to Carrieres de Lumieres close by (you can get a combination pass for both). We wandered the medieval town (lots of fun little shops and boutiques) and then explored the castle ruins above. The audioguide for the castle ruins was very informative. You can just picture what life was like so long ago! Medieval weaponry is displayed throughout the grounds as well. The views from the top are stunning! The mistral wind was blowing in March, so it was quite cold! Don't miss this wonderful little historical village!

title: Wonderful Winery, great wines!
text: We enjoyed our wine tasting visit at Madrigal. My brother (who is a sommelier) recommended it, and we were very pleased. The wines are excellent (we bought several bottles to bring back home) and the sommelier there was very helpful and full of great information. I highly recommend a visit here. Nice change from the bigger, more commercial wineries.

title: Arles Amphitheater views!
text: Hotel Spa Le Calendal was very pleasant. We were only there one night, but the room was spacious and clean. The staff was very kind and arranged dinner reservations for us. The location is great for exploring Arles. Breakfast was not included for us, but we had delicious croissants and coffees. I would recommend staying here while in Arles.

title: Tapas in Arles
text: Our hotel recommended Bodguita and made us a reservation. The tapas were quite good as was the wine (we got a bottle of wine to bring back to our hotel). The "plate mi charcut mi cheese" tapas was great. We got to try some different meats and cheeses that we enjoyed a lot. The service was fine, but not excellent.

title: Amazing accommodations! 5 stars not high enough!
text:
I cannot say enough about Aurelia B&B or the fantastic hosts there! We stayed there last week, and we were so impressed in every way. If ever in Mostar, I would never stay anywhere else. We were in Bosnia with another couple, and we felt completely at home at Aurelia.The hosts were friendly, caring, helpful, and attentive. Communication before we arrived was excellent (Džan even drove into town to escort us in as the nearby road was under construction).

The location to old town Mostar is very convenient, just a short walk. The breakfast was amazing--and so much food! Emina is an excellent cook and made a variety of delicious foods for us. Džan and Emina were so informative about Mostar and their personal stories of living their lives in Bosnia. Rooms are spacious, nicely appointed, and very clean. They truly care about their home, gardens, and guests. Everything was impeccable!

title: Nice experience in Nice, fantastic host!
text: We weren't sure where to eat in Nimes, and we were there a little late for a traditional lunch. We chose Au P'tit Nimes as it looked to be the best in the square. The menu is extensive, the food was "okay." However, I do want to rave about the service and the courteous staff. We were treated wonderfully, with good humor, and efficiency. Another table actually complained about slow service which shocked us. We thought the service to be excellent. We talked to the owner quite a bit, exchanged English and French phrases, and enjoyed our experience here (we were the last customers there before they closed, but they didn't rush us out at all). Although the food wasn't the best we we had on our trip, the experience was very pleasant. Cheers to the owner and his family!

title: New in Midtown
text: The Embassy Suites Midtown is a conveniently located, clean, new hotel. We were able to easily walk to Times Square and many other locations. The room was very clean and comfortable, but small (although that seems typical in NYC). The sitting area is quite small and not easily usable for more than one person. The bed was comfortable, and the blackout curtains helped us sleep in and relax. The breakfast offered lots of choices including an omelet station. The staff were all friendly, but the bar staff was especially so. The only complaint I have was that the elevator was extremely slow. Good choice--I highly recommend it.
place: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square

title: Amazing Amphitheatre
text: We truly enjoyed visiting the best preserved Roman arena. Arenes de Nimes dates from about A.D. 100. This site highlights the perfection in early Roman architecture. The design and construction are both incredible. This site provides an excellent audioguide (so much information!), and great "re-enactment" audio files. Don't pay for the extra tablet tour--the audioguide is plenty. There are very informative panels throughout the arena that work very well with the audioguide (panels are in both French and English). Take your time and go to the very top--great views of the city, but also of the arena itself. It provides a great perspective, the same the early Romans had of this great arena. I liked being able to actually get out onto the actual arena floor--incredible.

title: Ancient Aqueduct
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to Pont du Gard. There is an informative museum prior to visiting the bridge which was quite good. It explains how the bridge was built and how it influenced the town of Nimes. This is a wonderfully preserved Roman bridge which was part of a 30 mile aqueduct, and it is very impressive. Park on the River Left (Rive Gauche) to the museum, ticket booth, etc.

title: Quiet, lovely Villa Victoria
text: This quaint hotel is in the heart of Nice. It is quite close to both the Promenade des Anglais and Vieux Nice, or Old Nice (Old Town). Both are in easy walking distance. Villa Victoria has a lovely garden area in back. It was chilly when we visited, but I can just imagine sitting out there sipping coffee or a glass of wine--very beautiful. The staff at the hotel were all very efficient and friendly. I emailed with them several times prior to our stay and I always received helpful and prompt replies. We had a nice little balcony with city views. The breakfast had many different options. I would highly recommend staying here. I just wish we had been able to stay longer!

title: Vieux Nice
text: I absolutely loved the Old Town in Nice! I honestly wasn't as excited about visiting Nice as I was about some other places on our trip, but was very pleasantly surprised. We actually even went there a couple of times during our visit to the Riviera. Wandering down the little lanes of the Old Town, visiting charming shops, experiencing the culture of this area, and enjoying some delicious meals was a wonderful experience. Take time to stroll, people watch, and just enjoy the charm of this place.

title: Pre-Theater Italian Dinner
text: We met my sister and her husband at Osteria al Doge before seeing Aladdin in Times Square. It is very conveniently located to the theater district, just an easy walk over. We enjoyed our dinners, mainly very traditional entrees. It is a very busy place, so I recommend making reservations (especially if you are heading to the theater afterwards). I had the filetto di maiale which is a roasted pork loin with a delicious rosemary sauce. Fun night!

title: Beautiful vineyard, nice wines
text: We were very excited about visiting Duckhorn vineyards. We have enjoyed their wines over the years, and were looking forward to trying some of their other options. The vineyard is in a beautiful setting. The building has a gorgeous wrap-around porch and is lovely. Our sommelier was very attentive and knowledgeable. We enjoyed our wine tasting with a delicious charcuterie plate. A couple of wines we tried included a 2014 Gowan Creek Pinor Noir, a 2014 Carneros Merlot, a 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Patzimaro Vineyard), and a 2013 from Napa called the Discussion. Very nice experience.

title: Lovely Le Cave, Marvelous Mougins
text: Wonderful place to have a glass (or two!) of wine and great light food. I had the omelette which was delicious, but the side salad with it was beyond incredible! So many flavors and options. (I am super picky, but the combination in this salad was one I hope to recreate--delicious!) Grapes, pine nuts, green onion, carrot, walnut, tomato, golden raisins, jicama, dried fruit, bamboo shoots, radish, peas... absolutely wonderful! We loved the wine selections. The "cave" has great wine selections. We especially loved the La Gigondas wines. The staff was very accommodating, and we enjoyed our time to tour the cave. It is small, but they have excellent selections. The views are magnificent, and this was the perfect place to celebrate being in France our first day. Loved the village of Mougins as well.

title: Friday Night Food Truck Fun!
text: Off the Grid was such a fun event! We went to one of the early events at the beginning of the season (it is not open year-round, open Mar-Oct) and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. It has so many food options to choose from! The food trucks were amazing--wine and beer, tasty food options, DJ and live music round out a great night. This was a great place to start our night.
place: Off the Grid: Fort Mason Center

title: NYC Landmark Theater!
text: We were able to visit the New Amsterdam Theater for the first time and saw Aladdin. This beautiful theater is where my great aunt performed in the 1920's as a Ziegfeld Folly girl, so I was very excited to experience this! We had seats to the very far left in the theater which were a little tough, but the theater itself was very nice. I don't think there is a bad seat in the house. Very ornate, historical feeling, and beautiful. Aladdin was a great show (the Magic Carpet ride was incredibly done!). The theater was lovely and did not disappoint. I would highly recommend seeing a Broadway play here.

title: Proud of Pride!
text: My step-brother recommended visiting Pride, and what a great recommendation! Pride is an incredible vineyard! The tour and tastings were both fabulous. We learned so much from our sommelier about the vineyard, wines, and the entire area. The windy road to the top of the mountain was gorgeous! I highly recommend visiting. Call to set up an appointment first as reservations are the way to go. The tour through the caves and grounds is well worth it. Our only problem was finding a way to get all the wine we bought back home! :)

title: Excellent service, beautiful view
text: We stopped at Father Rooster's for a drink and a snack after spending a few hours on the beach. The staff was friendly, and service was very good. We had the Patacones, a plantain appetizer which was delicious (the guacamole and bean dip were excellent!). My husband and son-in-law had the Rooster Ritas which were very good. I had the El Sabanero which was awesome and extremely refreshing (Cacique, Midori, lemon juice, sugar & peppermint leaves). It was a nice, relaxing place to end our day in the sun.

title: Typical Hard Rock, but nice
text: This Hard Rock wasn't too dissimilar than most, but it was a great place to grab an appetizer and a couple of drinks right after arriving in Playas del Coco. It was conveniently located at the bottom of the hill from our rental house in Pacifico. Service was excellent, drinks were average. We had a mixed platter of appetizers that was pretty good. Easy choice for our first day.

title: Way overpriced! Mediocre at best.
text: There were only two choices for places to eat at Liberia airport, Players and Quiznos. We wanted a celebratory drink with our daughter and son-in-law, so we tried Players. $14 mimosas! Way overpriced. The food was typical bar food, nothing great. I will say our server was attentive at least. I think I'd grab a sandwich at Quiznos next time.

title: Denver Tradition!
text: Fun, quirky place in Cherry Creek. Love the history of the place. Their burgers are good, but the topping choices are the real gem. My daughter loves getting their "frings" and their beer selection is quite good.

title: Craft brews, good food, nice setting
text: My daughter and son-in-law introduced us to Breckenridge Brewery. The four of us have been there many times, and just my husband and I have gone many times as well, so this review is not based on a one-time visit. We typically enjoy going for brunch or lunch on the weekends as there are a lot of fun things happening at the Farmhouse (food trucks, outdoor beer garden, corn hole, special events, and more). The food is quite good, and we all enjoy their craft beers (the Agave Wheat is my favorite, my hubby loves the 471 IPA Barrel Aged). Their beer flights are fun to try as well! We also enjoy getting specialty beers to bring home (try their growlers, or we just bought a mini keg of the Christmas Ale for our upcoming holiday party). Breckenridge Brewery has become one of our favorite spots!
place: Farm House Restaurant at Breckenridge Brewery

title: Wines on Tap!
text: We went to Carboy Winery for Father's Day this year. Lots of good small plates to choose from. We went overboard with the oysters--yummy (although I do not see them on their website right now)! Wines were also quite good. We've only been once, but I'm eager to return and try some other wines there. You can even join their wine club. Worth revisiting for sure!
